quiz.questionText: Java is a(n) ______-oriented programming language
quiz.feedback: Object-oriented programming (OOP) is a programming paradigm based on the concept of objects, which can contain data and code: data in the form of fields (often known as attributes or properties), and code, in the form of procedures (often known as methods).

quiz.questionText: Python is a(n) _______ high-level general-purpose programming language.
quiz.feedback: An interpreter is a computer program that directly executes instructions written in a programming or scripting language, without requiring them previously to have been compiled into a machine language program.

quiz.questionText: In which platform is Java the most popular language in use?
quiz.feedback: Instagram, Facebook are not programming/hosting platforms. Stack Overflow is a programming support site. GitHub is the guy for you.

quiz.questionText: Java syntax is similar to
quiz.feedback: The syntax of Java is similar to C and C++, but has fewer low-level facilities than either of them.

quiz.questionText: Who is the father of the C language?
quiz.feedback: A successor to the programming language B, C was originally developed at Bell Labs by Dennis Ritchie between 1972 and 1973 to construct utilities running on Unix.

quiz.questionText: JDK is used to compile, debug and execute the java programs.
quiz.feedback: The Java Development Kit (JDK), which is intended for software developers and includes development tools such as the Java compiler, Javadoc, Jar, and a debugger.

quiz.questionText: The java file extension is .py
quiz.feedback: That is the file extension for a python file.

quiz.questionText: Python is case sensitive when dealing with identifiers
quiz.feedback: Python is case sensitive when dealing with identifiers, so they won't get mixed up.

quiz.questionText: Class is a core data type in Python programming.
quiz.feedback: Class is a user-defined data type.

quiz.questionText: The output of print(math.pow(3, 2)) is 9.0
quiz.feedback: math.pow() returns a floating number (decimal).

quiz.questionText: What is the truncation division operator in Python?
quiz.feedback: // is truncated because it will only display the integer part of the quotient.

quiz.questionText: Type in the output of this: min(max(False,-3,-4), 2,7)
quiz.feedback: The function max() is being used to find the maximum value from among -3, -4 and false. Since false amounts to the value zero, hence we are left with min(0, 2, 7) Hence the output is 0 (false).

quiz.questionText: Fill in the blank. The package used for text formatting in Java programming language is java.____
quiz.feedback: java.text allows formatting, searching and manipulating text.

quiz.questionText: Enter in the complied Java class file extension.
quiz.feedback: The compiled java files have .class extension.

quiz.questionText: Enter in which environment variable is used to set the java path.
quiz.feedback: JAVA_HOME is used to store a path to the java installation.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is not a segment of memory in java?
quiz.feedback: There are only 3 types of memory segment. Stack Segment, Heap Segment and Code Segment.

quiz.questionText: Which exception is thrown when java is out of memory?
quiz.feedback: The Xms flag has no default value, and Xmx typically has a default value of 256MB. A common use for these flags is when you encounter a java.lang.OutOfMemoryError.

quiz.questionText: Which of these cannot be used for a variable name in Java?
quiz.feedback: Keywords are specially reserved words that can not be used for naming a user defined variable, for example: class, int, for, etc.

quiz.questionText: Which of the following is a type of polymorphism in Java Programming?
quiz.feedback: There are two types of polymorphism in Java. Compile time polymorphism (overloading) and runtime polymorphism (overriding).

quiz.questionText: Which of these coding types is used for data type characters in Java?
quiz.feedback: Unicode defines fully international character set that can represent all the characters found in all human languages. Its range is from 0 to 65536.
